subtests.name: Default event values for mouse event interface and its pointer lock extensions.
Default event values for pointerlockerror using a dictionary
Element interface: operation requestPointerLock()
Element must be primary interface of window.document.documentElement
subtests.message: assert_equals: window.document.documentElement's prototype is not Element.prototype expected object "[object ElementPrototype]" but got object "[object HTMLHtmlElementPrototype]"

subtests.name: Stringification of window.document.documentElement
subtests.message: assert_equals: class string of window.document.documentElement expected "[object Element]" but got "[object HTMLHtmlElement]"

subtests.name: Element interface: window.document.documentElement must inherit property "requestPointerLock" with the proper type (0)
Document interface: attribute onpointerlockchange
Document interface: attribute onpointerlockerror
Document interface: attribute pointerLockElement
Document interface: operation exitPointerLock()
Document must be primary interface of window.document
subtests.message: assert_equals: window.document's prototype is not Document.prototype expected object "[object DocumentPrototype]" but got object "[object HTMLDocumentPrototype]"

subtests.name: Stringification of window.document
subtests.message: assert_equals: class string of window.document expected "[object Document]" but got "[object HTMLDocument]"

subtests.name: Document interface: window.document must inherit property "onpointerlockchange" with the proper type (0)
Document interface: window.document must inherit property "onpointerlockerror" with the proper type (1)
Document interface: window.document must inherit property "pointerLockElement" with the proper type (2)
Document interface: window.document must inherit property "exitPointerLock" with the proper type (3)
MouseEvent interface: attribute movementX
MouseEvent interface: attribute movementY
MouseEvent must be primary interface of new MouseEvent('mousemove')
Stringification of new MouseEvent('mousemove')
MouseEvent interface: new MouseEvent('mousemove') must inherit property "movementX" with the proper type (0)
MouseEvent interface: new MouseEvent('mousemove') must inherit property "movementY" with the proper type (1)
MouseEvent must be primary interface of new MouseEvent('pointerlockchange')
Stringification of new MouseEvent('pointerlockchange')
MouseEvent interface: new MouseEvent('pointerlockchange') must inherit property "movementX" with the proper type (0)
MouseEvent interface: new MouseEvent('pointerlockchange') must inherit property "movementY" with the proper type (1)
Test that movementX/Y = eNow.screenX/Y-ePrevious.screenX/Y
Test that movementX/Y not equals to eNow.screenX/Y-ePrevious.screenX/Y when the pointer is clipped by the screen boundary
Test that movementX/Y = eNow.screenX/Y-ePrevious.screenX/Y
Test that movementX/Y not equals to eNow.screenX/Y-ePrevious.screenX/Y when the pointer is clipped by the screen boundary
Test that the pointer properly be locked in a DOM element
Test that the pointer lock properly be exited, the cursor is at the same location when exited
Test that no engagement gesture is required to reenter pointer lock if pointer lock is exited via exitPointerLock
Test validates that each requestPointerLock() will fire a pointerlockchange event
Test that pointer lock won't be exited when fullscreen is entered or exited with script
Test that pointer lock is exited when fullscreen is entered or exited with the same user gesture
Test that movementX/Y provided indefinitely even when the mouse cursor would have otherwise hit the edge of a screen
Test that pointer lock will be lost when the current Tab loses focus
Test that pointer lock will be lost when the user agent / window loses focus
Test that pointer lock will be lost when taking the target element out of the DOM
